intro: Humiriastrum colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian humiriastrum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Humiriastrum colombianum is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
